etymologies: mid 17th century: from Latin, literally ‘makeweight’, perhaps from Etruscan

definitions: the part of a logarithm that follows the decimal point.
shortDefinitions: part of logarithm after decimal point

definitions: the part of a floating-point number that represents the significant digits of that number, and that is multiplied by the base raised to the exponent to give the actual value of the number.
shortDefinitions: part of floating-point number which represents significant digits of that number
